alert.note: Alert for Pike (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 12:55AM CST until January 26 at 12:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana...Mississippi... Tangipahoa River Near Robert affecting Tangipahoa Parish. Tangipahoa River At Osyka affecting Pike County. For the Tangipahoa River...including Osyka, Kentwood, Tangi. River near Tickfaw, Amite, Robert...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tangipahoa River at Osyka. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Pastures and woodlands along with some crop land near the river will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 12.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.0 feet this evening. The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 10/04/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM CST.
